task_summary: Detect the green bottle, align laterally, orient the tool, push it leftward along the table surface, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator works on a white tabletop with multiple objects aligned near the table edge: a green bottle, a clear cup, a red cuboid, a small can, stacked orange cups, and a blue can. The instruction asks to push a bottle. Visual evidence shows the end-effector approaching the green bottle from its right side and executing a lateral push without grasping. The behavior prioritizes perception, approach and alignment, yaw adjustment for side contact, a short controlled push, and a small retreat to clear the object.
preconditions: Workspace is clear of obstacles along the push direction.
Bottle is on the table and visible to perception.
Controller limits allow lateral contact motion.
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to the bottle with modest tolerance.
Set end-effector yaw to present a flat pushing face.
Execute a lateral push of 0.15 m (approx.) toward the left.
Retreat 0.10 m to clear the object after motion.
success_criteria: Bottle translates along the tabletop in the commanded direction by roughly the push distance.
No grasp occurs; contact is sliding.
Robot remains within workspace limits with no collisions.
End-effector retreats to a safe pose after the push.
failure_and_recovery: Object not detected → retry perception/adjust view.
Misalignment causes slip → re-approach and re-align, then re-push.
Insufficient motion due to friction → repeat push or increase distance.
Unexpected contact force → abort push and retreat.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the push completes and the robot has retreated to a safe clearance.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Detect the specified bottle in the scene.
Approach the bottle and align the tool with modest tolerance.
Rotate TCP yaw to present a side for pushing.
Push the bottle laterally along the table.
Back off to clear the object after pushing.

failure_modes: Insufficient displacement due to friction or obstacle
recovery_strategy: Re-run detection from slightly different viewpoint
Abort and Retreat if contact force anomaly detected
assumptions: The instruction refers to the green bottle visible in all frames.
World frame for direction uses 180° as leftward on the table; exact mapping not observable from frames.
A side push is appropriate; no grasp required.

expected_success_criteria: Bottle translates left ~0.15 m without tipping
